details: For asthmatic complaints; worse from inhaling any dust. HYSTERIA. Erratic spasmodic pains. "Will-o'-the-wisp" like character of its subjective symptoms and its physometric property are special features. (Samuel Jones.) INFLATION AND TENSION IN THE ABDOMEN. Miller's asthma.

Head: Absent-minded, irritable
Headache in SINGLE SPOTS, with VIOLENT PULSATION OF TEMPORAL ARTERIES
Outward drawing from glabella
Better in open air
Red swelling across the bridge of the nose
Respiratory: Troublesome respiration, with sudden feeling of anguish and sweat
Pain in chest, with difficult breathing

name: Pothos foetidus
